column4: Some pianists and musicologists consider the piece to be one of Chopin's most technically challenging compositions.

column4: The piece is characterized by its use of arpeggios and chromatic harmonies, which are typical of Chopin's piano music.

column4: Chopin Nocturne No. 15 in F Minor, Op. 55, No. 1 is one of the most popular piano pieces by Frederic Chopin.
column5: 쇼팽 녹턴(야상곡) 15번 F Minor Op. 55, No. 1은 Frederic Chopin의 가장 인기 있는 피아노 작품 중 하나입니다.

column4: It is part of a set of three nocturnes, published in 1844.

column4: The piece is known for its dreamy, melancholic melody and its use of the pedal to create a hazy, ethereal sound.

column4: It is a staple of piano repertoire and is often performed by professional pianists.

column4: The piece is featured in several films and television shows, including "The Pianist" and "Twin Peaks."

column4: It is one of Chopin's most frequently recorded nocturnes.

column4: Chopin himself considered the 3 nocturnes Op.55 among his best works.

column4: The piece is in ternary form, with the middle section featuring a contrasting melody.

column4: The piece is a good example of Chopin's use of dissonance.

column4: Chopin's Nocturnes were highly influential in the development of the genre and the composer's style.
column5: 쇼팽의 녹턴(야상곡)은 장르와 작곡가의 스타일 발전에 큰 영향을 미쳤습니다.

column4: Chopin wrote the work in 1842, but did not publish it until 1844.
column5: 쇼팽은 1842년에 작품을 썼지만 1844년까지 출판하지 않았습니다.

column4: The nocturne is dedicated to a friend of Chopin, the pianist Julian Fontana.
column5: 녹턴(야상곡)은 쇼팽의 친구인 피아니스트 줄리안 폰타나에게 헌정되었습니다.

column4: Chopin's nocturnes were inspired by the Irish composer John Field, who invented the genre.
column5: 쇼팽의 녹턴(야상곡)은 이 장르를 발명한 아일랜드 작곡가 존 필드에게서 영감을 받았습니다.

column4: The piece is a good example of Chopin's preference for the flat keys, which he believed to be more expressive.
column5: 이 작품은 쇼팽이 더 표현력이 있다고 믿었던 플랫 건반에 대한 선호의 좋은 예입니다.

column4: Chopin himself did not use the term "nocturne" to describe the pieces, it was coined by his publisher.
column5: 쇼팽 자신은 작품을 설명하기 위해 "녹턴(야상곡)"이라는 용어를 사용하지 않았으며 그의 출판사에서 만든 것입니다.

column4: The piece features a repetitive, left-hand accompaniment pattern known as an "ostinato."

column4: Chopin's nocturnes were often inspired by his own personal experiences and emotions.
column5: 쇼팽의 녹턴(야상곡)은 종종 자신의 개인적인 경험과 감정에서 영감을 받았습니다.

column4: The piece was first performed by Chopin himself in 1844.
column5: 이 작품은 1844년에 쇼팽 자신이 처음으로 연주했습니다.

column4: Chopin's nocturnes were considered revolutionary in their time for their departure from traditional forms and harmonic language.
column5: 쇼팽의 녹턴(야상곡)은 전통적인 형식과 조화로운 언어에서 벗어남으로 인해 당대에 혁명적인 것으로 여겨졌습니다.

column4: Chopin's nocturnes have been arranged for a variety of other instruments, including the violin, cello and guitar.
column5: 쇼팽의 녹턴(야상곡)은 바이올린, 첼로, 기타 등 다양한 악기를 위해 편곡되었습니다.

column4: The nocturne is a good example of Chopin's use of rubato, a technique in which the tempo is temporarily varied for expressive effect.
